title: Great Ocean Road devastated by flash flooding; Protesters fight state anti-protest laws | 7NEWS
description: Flash flooding along Victoria's Great Ocean Road has stranded hundreds of holidaymakers after more than 180 millimetres of rain fell in less than five hours, sweeping cars out to sea at Wye River. The Great Ocean Road remains closed between Skeens Creek and Lorne, with emergency centres opened in Lorne and Apollo Bay. Three heroes from the Bondi terror attack will receive keys to the city for their life-saving bravery during the incident. title: Flash flooding strands hundreds on Great Ocean Road | 7NEWS
description: Flash flooding has stranded hundreds of holidaymakers along Victoria's Great Ocean Road after more than 180 millimetres of rain fell in less than five hours. The freak deluge swept cars out to sea at White River, with numerous people requiring rescue. As many as 800 people are now without a home following the tsunami-like surge, with emergency centres opened in Lorne and Apollo Bay and the Great Ocean Road closed between Skeens Creek and Lorne. title: Perth man arrested with gun disguised as smartphone | 7NEWS
description: A 32-year-old man from Mount Claremont, Perth, has been arrested for allegedly possessing a firearm disguised as a smartphone. The arrest followed a dramatic police chase through the Perth Hills on Wednesday night after the man fled from a traffic stop in Leederville. He was apprehended in Mount Helena with several rounds of ammunition in his possession. title: Man arrested with crossbow at Adelaide station | 7NEWS
description: A 24-year-old man from Elizabeth Vale was arrested at Adelaide railway station after passengers reported seeing a crossbow concealed in a suitcase on a train. South Australian police, who have been conducting heightened weapon searches at the station as part of a public precinct declaration, charged the man with possession of a prohibited weapon. He was granted bail, banned from using trains for three months, and will appear in court in March. title: Sydney protesters defy new anti-protest laws | 7NEWS
description: Hundreds of demonstrators are set to gather at Sydney Town Hall to protest New South Wales' new anti-protest laws, which restrict protesters' freedom of movement until the 20th of the month. The rally also opposes the planned visit of Israeli President Isaac Herzog to Australia, with protesters calling on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to deny the visit. A significant police presence including riot squad officers is expected at the event. title: US seizes Venezuelan oil tanker in the Caribbean
description: The US has conducted a pre-dawn raid in the Caribbean to capture its sixth oil tanker as they attempt to control Venezuelan oil. #usa #oiltanker #venezuela #mariacorinamachado #machado

title: Trump tower proposed for the Gold Coast
description: The US president has his sights set on the Gold Coast, with a Trump tower being proposed for a recently sold site at Surfer's Paradise. #goldcoast #trumptower #trump #surfersparadise #building

title: Human remains found on Phillip Island
description: A major homicide investigation is underway after human remains were discovered on Phillip Island by a tradie digging a trench. #police #investigation #discovery #phillipisland #victoria

title: Thousands without power in Ukraine after Russia strikes grid
description: Thousands of Ukrainians are having to brave harsh winter conditions without power after Russia targeted parts of the country's power grid, as overnight temperatures drop to below -20 degrees. #ukraine #russia #powergrid #winter #freezing

title: 'Nothing short of a rain bomb': Flash flooding chaos strikes holiday hotspot | 7NEWS
description: Flash flooding from a 180mm 'rain bomb' displaced 400 holidaymakers across Victoria's surf coast on Thursday. Emergency services evacuated campers from the Erskine, Cumberland and Wye River areas as the deluge swept through at terrifying speed. title: 'We're just fortunate everyone got out': Community rallies after Victoria flooding | 7NEWS
description: Surf Coast Shire Mayor Libby Stapleton speaks with Sunrise about the flash flooding that forced the evacuation of 200 holidaymakers from campgrounds near Lorne on Victoria's surf coast. The Lorne community rallied quickly, with the surf lifesaving club, local school and op shop all providing emergency support to those displaced. title: Man shot in leg during early morning attack at Villawood, Sydney
description: A man has been shot in the leg during an early morning attack at Villawood in Sydney's west. #villawood #westernsydney #sydney #sydneycrime #nswpolice

title: 'When it was at my knees, I knew it was time to go': Dad's flood escape with kids | 7NEWS
description: Camper Shannon describes the moment floodwaters rose to his knees at a Lorne campsite, forcing him to evacuate his family. A kind stranger named Shirley watched his children for three hours while the community rallied to help save belongings. title: Millions of accounts removed under Australia's social media ban, eSafety says
description: Over 4.7 million accounts have been taken down since Australia's social media ban for under-16s came into effect last month, according to new figures released by eSafety. #socialmedia #socialmediaban #esafety #australia #auspol

title: Baggy green cap worn by Don Bradman expected to fetch $1 million at auction
description: The baggy green cap worn by Sir Donald Bradman in his final Test on Australian soil is going up for auction this month. It's been kept in pristine condition for more than 70 years and is expected to fetch bids over $1 million. #baggygreen #donbradman #cricket #australia #auction
